summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on August 12, 2019, commanding the recipient to appear forthwith and produce documents and materials related to Jeffrey Epstein and the recipient's location and activities on August 9-10, 2019. It includes a rider with legal advice and detailed instructions for document production.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to gather evidence for a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Time period under scrutiny

events.title: Time period under scrutiny

One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is a 'FORTHWITH' grand jury subpoena, indicating urgent demand for immediate appearance and document production.
It seeks all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including communications and electronic data.
It specifically demands evidence of the recipient's location and activities between the evening of August 9, 2019, and midday August 10, 2019, a critical time period shortly after Epstein's death.
The subpoena demands any cellphone used by the recipient since July 6, 2019, suggesting a focus on communications around the time of Epstein's arrest and death.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman and references potential violations of federal statutes including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371) and false statements (18 U.S.C. ยง 1001).
